tool.name: sourmash tax prepare
tool.description: convert csv taxonomy files into sqlite
tool.command: sourmash tax prepare --taxonomy #for $t in $taxonomy_files: $t #end for #if $database_type == "csv": -o tax.csv -F csv #else: -o tax.db -F sql #end if

expand.help: The 'tax prepare' command reads in one or more taxonomy databases and saves them into a new database either as CSV or a SQLite database.

param.name: database_type
param.label: Database Type
param.help: Choose the type of the output database. SQLite databases are much faster for large taxonomies, while CSV files are easier to view and modify using spreadsheet software.

tool.help:
**Sourmash Taxonomy**
The sourmash tax subcommands support taxonomic analysis of genomes and taxonomic profiling of metagenomes.
**prepare**
Converts CSV taxonomy files to SQLite databases or combines multiple files for faster `tax` operations.
@taxa_file_help@
